Ref. No.: {{ doc.name }}
{% set appointment_date = frappe.utils.getdate(doc.appointment_date) %}
Date of Joining: {{ appointment_date.strftime("%d-%m-%Y") }}
 
Name of Employee: {{ doc.applicant_name }}
 
Address: {{ doc.custom_address or ""}}
 

Letter of Appointment

{% set appicant_doc = frappe.get_doc("Job Applicant",doc.job_applicant ) %}
Dear Mr./Mrs. {{ doc.applicant_name }}

With reference to your application and the interview you had with EN-VISION (EN-VISION enviro technologies Pvt Ltd OR its subsidiaries / Company), you {{ doc.applicant_name }} have been appointed in our organization {{ doc.company }} on the terms and conditions as detailed hereunder:

  1. Designation, Joining, and Compensation:
    1. Your designation will be {{ appicant_doc.designation }} and you will be based at location.
      2. {% set appointment_date = frappe.utils.getdate(doc.appointment_date) %}
    2. Your Date of Joining is: {{ appointment_date.strftime("%d-%m-%Y") }}.
    3. Your Compensation structure is annexed herewith as Annexure A.
  2. Probation:
    1. To begin with, you will be on probation for a period of six months from the date you join the duty. This period can be further extended either in parts or at a stretch depending upon your performance.
    2. It is made clear that on completion of the stipulated probationary period including extensions, if any, unless your services are confirmed in writing, your probation period shall be deemed to have been extended till you get a communication from the company in writing confirming or terminating your services.
    3. During the period of probation or the extended period of probation or the end of it, if your performance including discipline is not found satisfactory, your services may be terminated without notice or compensation and without assigning any reason whatsoever. During probation, you will have no claim for normal or any other increments in salary which other permanent employees may be offered.
    4. The Employee agrees if asked to sign an agreement for minimum service length in the company. This agreement shall be offered to be signed separately by Employee under specific circumstances.
  3. General:
    1. The nature of your job is described and specified in Annexure-B attached to this letter. Please acknowledge and sign the same as a token of your acceptance. Such a job description is indicative, and you may be assigned other work as per the requirement of the business.
    2. During the period of your services with the company, you will devote your full time and attention to the service of the company. You will faithfully and honestly discharge the duties assigned to you from time to time, and you will not indulge in any business directly or through any other means prejudicial to the interest of the company in your private account, even in an honorary capacity.
    3. Your designation is only suggestive, and you will do the entire work ancillary to or connected with your job, as advised by the management from time to time.
    4. You will work in any section/department as communicated to you by management from time to time, with a high standard of initiative, efficiency, and economy.
    5. You will observe and obey all lawful rules, regulations, orders, Company Policies (including but not limited to the Employee handbook, Information Technology-related policies), and instructions that may be in force currently and/or which the management and/or your superiors may issue from time to time. You will also bring to the notice of your superiors forthwith any errors/mistakes you have committed in the process of your working or any mistakes/errors/defaults committed by other employees or likelihood of fraudulent practices adopted by other employee(s) and which have come to your notice/knowledge.
    6. Employee will not indulge in any activities, conduct, behavior, or practices which harm the interest and reputation of the Employer such as:
      1. The willful destruction or misuse of the property (including any intellectual or intangible properties) of the Employer or an Affiliate having a material value to the Employer or such Affiliate;
      2. Fraud, embezzlement, theft, or dishonest act which can harm the interest of the Employer or its Affiliates either directly or indirectly;
      3. Committing any crime, constituting a felony or any misdemeanor involving fraud, dishonesty, or moral turpitude;
      4. Committing breach, neglect, refusal, or failure to materially discharge his/her duties commensurate with her title and function, or failure to comply with the lawful directions of the Employer’s or an Affiliate’s instruction, policies, rules, guidelines;
      5. A willful and knowing material misrepresentation to the Employer either in the form of giving wrong information or hiding information;
      6. A willful violation of the policy of the Employer, which does or could result in harm to the Employer or to the Employer’s reputation;
      7. Material violation of a statutory or common law duty of loyalty or fiduciary duty to the Employer;
      8. Influencing other employees or being influenced by other employees or third parties in conducting or indulging in any activities within office premises or outside which may harm the interest directly or indirectly of the Employer.
    7. Employee hereby covenants and agrees that during the period of employment, or for such period as the Employer continues to employ or compensate the Employee in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, whichever is longer, the Employee shall not directly or indirectly, either as a principal, agent, employee, employer, consultant, partner, member of a limited liability company, shareholder of a closely held corporation, or shareholder in excess of two (2) percent of a publicly traded corporation, corporate officer or director, manager, or in any other individual or representative capacity, engage or otherwise participate in any manner or fashion in any business that is in competition in any manner whatsoever with the principal business activity of the Employer or its Affiliates, in or about any market in which the Employer or its Affiliates have or have publicly announced a plan to have business activities.
    8. You will be responsible for all the property of the company like tools, equipment, instruments, raw materials, books, drawings, and other similar items, directly entrusted to your care and custody or which have come into your possession for or/and during your work. You are responsible to maintain them in good, clean, and working condition and to hand them over in the same condition (save normal wear & tear) while you leave the service of the company or when so directed by the management.
    9. You will keep us informed in writing of any change of your residential address and/or civil status, and failing to do so, all communications intended to be served on you would be sent to your last given address and also displayed on the company’s notice board, and this shall be deemed to be sufficient service on you. Failure to communicate such changes in your residential address will also be deemed an act of misconduct.
    10. You will not reveal while in employment or thereafter to any individual or organization or social media, by word of mouth or otherwise, any particulars or any information including but not limited to, know-how, procedures, design tools and resources employed, design protocols and methodologies, manufacturing process, product investigations, research carried out, or any other technical, administrative security, financial or other organizational information, customer data, marketing strategies and schemes, any sensitive information related to directors or Key management personnel, obtained or derived from or disclosed by the company or company’s collaborators, clients, or associate companies whether confidential, secret, or otherwise, which you may get acquainted with while in employment. The company reserves the right to take appropriate legal actions if you are found in breach of provisions of this clause or any other clause of this appointment.
    11. Employee acknowledges that during the course of his service with EN-VISION, he/she is likely to obtain from time to time knowledge of trade secrets, Intellectual Property Rights, and Confidential Information of EN-VISION and its Affiliates and shall have dealings with the customers and suppliers of EN-VISION. Employee agrees to keep Confidential Information confidential during the tenure of this Agreement and for the period of 3 years from the date of termination of this Agreement.
    12. You will not seek membership in any local or public bodies or stand for elections thereof without the specific written permission of the management.
    13. You will not actively associate with any political parties and/or actively canvass/support any person belonging to any political party seeking office in public/government bodies.
    14. You shall be required to take prior written permission from the management in case you opt for pursuing further studies during the course of your employment with the company. You shall also communicate to the management if you are pursuing any course at the time of joining your duties in the company. Such further studies shall not hinder your work in the company in any way. Joining any course/further study whether full-time, part-time, correspondence or distance learning, e-course, or by any other means without the knowledge and prior written permission from the management will be deemed as an act of “misconduct.”
  4. Transfer :
    1. During the period of your services with the company you are liable to be transferred from one place to another and one job to another, one department to another, one unit to another, and one branch to another, whether existing at present or which may come into existence in future in the company and/or company, as the exigencies of the work demand or for the efficient working of the company.
    2. You will receive and accept any such orders of transfer without any condition.
    3. Failure to receive any order of transfer or failure to report for work at the transferred place of work when notified will be deemed as an act of misconduct. On your refusal to receive and/or obey such transfer orders, you will not be entitled to receive wages from the day you are supposed to work at the transferred place, and you will also be liable for disciplinary action including termination of employment.
  5. Retirement :
    1. You will retire from the service of the company without any notice on completion of 60 years of age.
    2. In case your services are extended after you attain 60 years of age, the date on which your services are discontinued will be deemed as the age of retirement in your case.
    3. The extension of your services will depend upon your being medically fit and your ability to carry out the work efficiently. The decision to retain your services beyond 60 years will be entirely at the discretion of the management, subject to your successfully undergoing the prescribed medical and work-related tests.
  6. Termination of Services / Resignation :
    1. Your services can be terminated, without any notice or compensation and without assigning any reason for loss of confidence, or for any actions including dishonesty, misappropriation of the company’s money or property, fraud, or any act subversive of discipline which also includes any direct or indirect communication act, behavior (including through any means) which in the opinion of the management is seriously detrimental/prejudicial to the interest/philosophy of the company and warrants your termination forthwith.
    2. If you absent yourself without leave or remain absent beyond the period of leave originally granted or subsequently extended, you shall be considered as having voluntarily terminated your employment without giving any notice unless you return to work within 8 (eight) days of the commencement of such absence and give an explanation to the satisfaction of the management regarding such absence.
    3. Should you desire to resign during Probation, you will be required to give one month’s notice to the Company. The company will not require to give you any advanced notice for relieving during the Probation period.

      Should you desire to resign after Confirmation, the notice period shall depend on the level of the employee at the time of leaving (level-wise notice period shall be mentioned in the Employee handbook) or an amount equivalent to the salary of months of the notice period (i.e. Basic salary plus all allowances) in lieu thereof. However, after confirmation, in case the company desires to relieve you from the services, the company shall also give a notice period in writing or an amount equivalent to the Notice period’s salary (i.e. Basic salary plus all allowances) in lieu thereof.
      It will be the sole discretion of the management to waive or reduce the notice period and get an amount equivalent to the balance notice period.
    4. It is expressly agreed and understood that your services are liable to be terminated without any notice for the following amongst other acts.
    1. If it is found at any time during the tenure of your employment that any of the information furnished by you to the management at the time of your appointment is incorrect or false.
    2. If at any time due to your acts or omissions in connection with your duties, employment, and business of the company, etc., the management loses confidence in you.
    3. If you are convicted for any act committed by you or if you are arrested for any act involving moral turpitude.
    4. If in the opinion of the management, you are found disloyal to or if you are found indulging in activities detrimental to the interest of the company. The following acts amongst others on your part will be considered to be detrimental.
      1. Engaging yourself in any other business, trade, and profession during your employment in the company during working hours or otherwise whether such activities conflict with the interest of the company or not.
      2. Divulging any information in respect of the business of the company to anybody or divulging trade secrets or other information relating to or connected with the business of the company or its Directors and Executives.
      3. Making statements orally or in writing or allegations against the company, its directors or Executives knowing the same to be false which in the opinion of the Management, will have an effect of lowering the prestige of the Company, Directors, Executives, etc.
      4. Disregarding Company’s various policies captured in Employee handbooks or any such documents.
      5. On default of any of the terms of this appointment letter.
    5. Your refusal for being transferred as contemplated in clauses 4.1 and 4.3 mentioned above.
    6. If you are medically (physically and/or mentally) unfit to continue with the job.
  7. Effect of Termination:

    Upon termination, for whatsoever reason, you will perform the following duties.

    1. Hand over all the assets of the Company to a designated person in good condition.
    2. Hand over all the information which is obtained during your employment with the Company including but not limited to passwords, login details, registration details, and status of existing affairs of the Company being handled by you.
    3. Handover drawing, blueprint, CDs (soft copy drawings/documents) or other data, tables, tools, calculations, letters or other documents or any other writing or copy of writing of any nature whatsoever pertaining to the business of the company or any of its subsidiaries if applicable
    4. Any other task performed by you related to your job responsibilities and various points mentioned as per the existing checklist of the Company prevailing from time to time.
  8. Non-Solicitation:
      During the term of his or her employment with the Employer and for a period of one (1) years from the date his or her employment with the Company ends for any reason, or till such time Employee continues to have benefit from the Employer, as a result of his or her employment with the Company, whichever is later, Employee will not, directly or indirectly, (a) hire, engage or solicit to hire or engage any individual who is employed by the Company (b) otherwise induce or attempt to induce any individual who is employed by the Company to terminate such engagement or employment, (c) in any way interfere with the relationship between the Company and any individual who is employed by the Company; (d) contact, solicit, divert, appropriate or call upon with the intent of doing business with (other than for the exclusive benefit of the Company) any customer of the Company if the purpose of such activity is to solicit such customer or prospective customer for a Competing Business, to encourage such customer to discontinue, reduce or adversely alter the amount of such customer’s business with the Company or to otherwise interfere with the Company’s relationship with such customer.
  9. Declaration:
      At the time of your joining service, or during your employment with the Company, you will give a declaration in writing about the details of your nominee to receive the legal dues with the company, membership of Provident Fund Scheme, etc., and if you are related to any directors of the company.
  10. Attendance and Working Hours:
      Your hours of work and shifts shall be regulated to suit the working of the enterprise and subject to the company policy prevailing from time to time and it will be notified from time to time. You will have to mark your attendance either through a Biometric system or punch card or in any other manner as may be prescribed from time to time.
  11. Salary Increase:
      Salary increments/promotions are not a matter of right and will be given at the discretion of the management depending on your performance, attendance, and behavior. You will be eligible for increments as per the company’s rule when your appointment is confirmed in the company.
  12. Fitness :
      Your appointment is subject to your being declared and remaining medically fit by a Medical Officer or by a doctor specified by the company. The management has the right to get you medically examined by any certified medical practitioner during the period of your service. In case you are found medically unfit to continue with the job you will lose your line on the job.
  13. Jurisdiction:
      Your appointment is made at Surat. In case of any dispute that may arise between you and the company in connection with your employment or in connection with any of the matters specified in this agreement, it is specifically agreed by and between the parties that the courts situated in the city of Surat alone will have jurisdiction to try and entertain such matters.

Your employment will also be subject to the terms of the Company policies prevailing and applicable from time to time.

In token of having accepted the above terms and conditions of service, you are requested to sign the duplicate copy of this letter and return the same to us.

With best wishes,

For

{{ doc.company }}

Nihar Doctor
Director

ACKNOWLEDGMENT:

  1. I have fully read, understood, and accepted the above terms and conditions.
  2. I have read the Employee handbook and other policies of the company and I will abide by them.
  3. All future communications from the company may be addressed to the following address:
